result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew W Hogstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for SIXTEEN (16) days time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  No electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept or other means.

Obtain GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment or school.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Defendant to participate with the Milwaukee County Day Reporting Center.
Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew W Hogstrom

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: /Order for Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges, signed and filed.  mn

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Protasiewicz Br 24 for review. os
Filed, sdg.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve SIX (6) MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for SIXTEEN (16) days time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  No electronic monitoring.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of FIFTEEN (15) MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
* Defendant to participate with the Milwaukee County Day Reporting Center.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH tax intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH tax intercept or other means.

Pursuant to 973.015, Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a class H or I felony or a misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence.  Court will grant expungement if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law, upon submission of motion.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

State RENEWS their motion to revoke.  Defense did not object to a factual basis for the revocation.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for 01-22-2016 is RESCHEDULED to 01-25-2016 at 01:30pm.  01-26-2016 Review hearing is CANCELLED.  sdg
Justice Point violation report received and filed./ds
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
Defendant fails to comply with monitoring.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

NO FILE IN COURT.   Justice report received and filed.  Defendant failing to comply with monitoring. Court lifts the stay on the Bench Warrant previously issued.  Court orders the bail to be forfeited.  Court sets case in Br. 33 for bail hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Honecker appears on behalf of JusticePoint.  sdg

Defense advises that Defendant MAY still be at Matt Talbot.  Defense will contact Matt Talbot in order to determine Defendant's location.  Defense requests that any Warrant issued be STAYED until Defense is able to contact Matt Talbot.  Clerk contacted JusticePoint,  Mr. Honecker advised the Court that the Defendant left him a voicemail regarding his tardiness.  Mr. Honecker advised that Defendant has been discharged from Matt Talbot due to non-compliance with ALL the rules at that facility.  Mr. Honecker has NOT been able to contact Rogers Memorial regarding Defendant's treatment.  COURT ISSUES AND STAYS A BENCH WARRANT UNTIL THE NEXT DATE  Review hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Court ordered turnover to JusticePoint for Placement.  Upon Placement,  Bail to revert back to $250.00 PR Bond.  sdg
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Dawn M Rablin for Darryl E. Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Matter in Court to address JusticePoint Violation.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the DPA.  State moves to REVOKE the DPA.  Court takes that motion under advisement at this time. Defendant taken into custody.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defense reports that Defendant is attending NA/AA meetings and has began Community Service.  Regarding the GED requirement of the DPA,  the Court is not satisfied with that condition at this time.  With agreement of parties, Court extends Deferred Prosecution Agreement to next court date.  Case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Defendant states he has had numerous health issues.  Defense asks for 45 day adjournment.  State does not object.  Review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point DPA Progress Report. Filed, sdg.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

Defendant made all contacts and is attending treatment. Defendant has had positive tests and needs to complete community service.   All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date. Case adjourned to branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No Gun or Drug Order signed and filed.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Laura Ann Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties have come to an agreement in this case.
Deferred prosecution agreement  DATED: 4-6-2015 received and filed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.   Court found defendant guilty as charged.  Court defers entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

The court further orders in the event the defendant fails to complete the stipulated conditions, that the state will move to dismiss this case.  If the defendant does not complete the conditions, the state will  proceed with the prosecution of this case.
The court orders as stipulated to by parties additional conditions as follows:
*Defendant to commit no new crimes that rise to the level of probable cause.
*Defendant will comply with all existing conditions of bail.
*Defendant waives his right to a jury trial.
*Defendant waives his right to confrontation and his right to compulsory attendance of witnesses.
*Defendant waives his right to a speedy jury trial.
*Defendant stipulates to the facts in the complaint and all elements of the crime charged.

Case adjourned for review in Branch 6, Judge Bromstrom.
  Review hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report.
Court changes the plea date to 4/6 on defense request. sab

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 4/20/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

15RM009942  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-20-2015

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Ron Dague for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/26/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in court with attorney David A. Feiss.  Defendant Andrew W Hogstrom in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
